Configuring Bandwidth

You can limit the bandwidth to reduce the rate at which the device transmits data. You can also use a bandwidth profile to limit the outbound traffic, which prevents the LAN users from consuming all of the bandwidth of the Internet link.

To set the upstream and downstream bandwidth:

 1. Choose QoS > Bandwidth Management.

 2. In the Bandwidth Management field, check Enable. The maximum bandwidth provided by your ISP appears in the Bandwidth section.

 3. In the Bandwidth Table, enter the following information for the WAN interface:

Upstream

The bandwidth (kb/s) used for sending data to the Internet.

Downstream

The bandwidth (kb/s) used for receiving data from the Internet. (Applies to the default VLAN only)

 4. Click Save.
